name: F1 Stromboli

name: F1 Green Magic

name: F1 Bellaverde Sibsey
description: Excellent flavour.

name: Gemini F1

name: Blue Finn F1

name: Summer Purple

name: Autumn Spear

name: Woc Broc

name: Autumn King 2

name: Amsterdam Forcing 3

name: F1 Maestro

name: F1 Fire Wedge

name: Chantenay Red Cored 2

name: F1 Resistafly

name: F1 Purple Haze

name: Samurai

name: F1 Octavo

name: Orla

name: Osprey

name: Caledonian Rose

name: Golden Wonder

name: Summer Frolic
description: Relatively early cropper.

name: San Marzano

name: Tamina

name: F1 Big League

name: Alicante
description: Reliable cropper or medium sized fruit.

name: Hundreds and Thousands

name: Moneymaker

name: Ailsa Craig

name: F1 Fantasio

name: Honey Delight F1

name: Heinz 1350

name: Tumbling Tom Red

name: F1 Shirley

name: F1 Sweet Million

name: Gardener's Delight

name: Red Alert

name: Romello F1
description: Cherry sized plum tomatoes. Blight resistance.

name: F1 Tumbler
description: Suitable for containers and hanging baskets.

name: Indigo Rose

name: Marmande

name: Crimsom Cocktail F1

name: Crimson Plum F1

name: Garnet

name: Red Zebra

name: Rosella

name: F1 Sungold

name: Sweet Aperitif

name: F1 Baby Boomer
description: Suitable for growing on patios.

name: Costoluto Fiorentino

name: Green Zebra

name: Koralik F1
description: Ripens relatively early in the summer with high yield.

name: Reisetomate

name: Cherry Falls
description: Great for baskets and containers with  good yields of fruit.

name: F1 Brandy Boy
description: Hybrid based on Brandy Boy heirloom variety to improve yield and flavour.

description: Strong flavoured garlic with large bulbs.

name: Cristo
description: Pure white bulbs. Suitable for spring planting.

name: Germidour
description: A mild flavoured garlic with distinctive violet skin covering the bulb.

name: Elephant

name: Vallelado

name: Messidrome
description: A French variety with good sized bulbs

name: Messidor
description: From Spain, produces large bulbs. Tolerates wet conditions.

name: Kingsland Wight
description: A French type, full of flavour. Can be spring planted.

name: Edenrose
description: Pretty looking pink bulbs containing numerous easy to peel cloves.

name: Early Onward
description: Good reputation, crops heavily early in the season.

name: Douce Provence
description: Hardy variety. Can be overwintered for early harvest.

name: Ambassador
description: Good disease resistance and able to cope with bad spring and summer weather.

name: Vivado
description: High yielding variety. Sweet tasting peas.

name: Kelvedon Wonder
description: A dwarf variety that is fast maturing. Good yield.

name: Hurst Greenshaft
description: Relatively long pea pods. Good for showing. Well regarded for flavour.

name: Lincoln
description: A heritage variety with curving pods. Sweet flavour.

name: Maro
description: A mushy pea variety. Less sweet when eaten fresh.

name: Shiraz
description: Distinctive purple colouring. Best eaten when young.

name: Stereo
description: Eat the whole pods when young. Sweet and nutty flavour.

name: Green Beauty
description: Attractive purple flowers and broad sweet pods.

name: Oregon Sugar Pod
description: A deliciously sweet tasting pea that is best eaten young.

name: Proval
description: A very early cropping variety. Can be overwintered.

name: Sweet Horizon
description: High yields of broad and sweet pods.

name: Delikett
description: Well regarded for its sweet flavour.

name: Blauwschokker
description: Green peas within distinctive purple pods. Can be eaten as mangetout.

name: Norli Sugar Pea
description: Well regarded for flavour. Medium sized pods.

name: Aquadulce Claudia
description: A reliable and hardy variety that can overwinter for a spring crop.

name: Statissa
description: Can be eaten like mangetout when small, or as beans when mature.

name: De Monica
description: Pods are long and filled with large beans. Can be overwintered.

name: Robin Hood
description: A dwarf variety suitable for growing in pots on the patio.

name: Giant Exhibition Longpod
description: A longpod bean with a good reputation for flavour. Good for showing.

name: Listra
description: Matures early in the season. Relatively short pods.

name: Karmazyn
description: A colourful red pink bean in a traditional green pod. Compact growth habit.

name: The Sutton
description: A heritage dwarf variety ideal for small gardens.

name: Masterpiece Green Longpod
description: A long podded variety well regarded for flavour.

name: Express
description: A fast growing variety for an early summer harvest.

name: Witkiem Manita
description: One of the quickest growing varieties, relatively short pods.

name: Crimson Flowered
description: Good for garden growing. Pretty flowers. Relatively short pods.

name: Super Aguadulce
description: Long pods full of beans.

name: F1 Sunta
description: A round cabbage noted for sweetness and its relatively thin leaves. Good for coleslaw.

name: F1 Mozart
description: Tolerates dry summers. Can be left to stand and picked when required.

name: Greyhound
description: A traditional variety that produces a pointed heart. Compact size good for small beds.

name: F1 Summer Jewel
description: Spring Green. Loose headed variety with long picking season.

name: F1 Dutchman
description: Produces a pointed heart, good reputation for flavour.

name: Golden Acre Primo
description: A round headed variety, good for shredding in salads.

name: Red Drumhead
description: A beautiful red and white fleshed round cabbage with green blue outer leaves.

name: Wheelers Imperial
description: Ready for harvest in spring and autumn.

name: F1 Winterjewel
description: An extremely hardy variety with dark leaves. If left to mature, it forms a small pointed head.

name: Hilton
description: A Chinese cabbage with a barrel shaped head. Good for stir fry.

name: F1 Natsuki
description: Chinese cabbage. Pick young for use in stir fry, or let it develop to full size.

name: F1 Lodero
description: Good disease resistance. Large red cabbage.

name: F1 Sweetie
description: A collard good for 'pick and come again' harvesting throughout the summer.

name: F1 Kilazol
description: A large round headed cabbage harvested in autumn or winter.

name: Cabbice F1
description: Lettuce like leaves, thin and tender, ideal for salads.

name: January King 3
description: A big, colourful, and hardy cabbage. Leave on the plot over winter and harvest when required.

name: F1 Serpentine
description: A highly regarded summer cabbage for flavour and ease of growing.

name: Ormskirk Rearguard
description: An ideal winter cabbage. A Savoy type with big curly outer leaves and a round head.

name: Chateaurenard
description: A fast maturing variety that forms a pointed head.

name: Drago F1
description: A small round variety that provides an autumn harvest.

name: Vertus
description: Crinkled leaved variety able to stand overwinter until required.

name: Caraflex F1
description: Large pointed heads that stand well whilst waiting for harvesting.

name: Mondeo
description: An all male hybrid that crops relatively early, and has good disease resistance.

name: Burgundine
description: Purple shoots, good for steaming or enjoyed raw.

name: Vittorio
description: Often grown for white asparagus (where shoots are earth up from the light).

name: Gijnlim
description: A green speared variety, crops relatively early, and has a good reputation for flavour

name: Guelph Millennium
description: A variety that originates from Canada, and is particularly hardy and suited to cold sites.

name: Pacific Purple
description: A tender late season purple asparagus that has an excellent reputation for flavour.

name: F1 Galine
description: Produces good amounts of relatively small, purple fruit.

name: F1 Pinstripe
description: A dwarf variety that grows cream and purple mini aubergines.

name: Black Beauty
description: Attractive large purple and red fruit  a classic aubergine shape and colour.

name: Globe 2
description: A round crimson beetroot. Suitable for showing.

name: Bulls Blood
description: Striking red bulbs and leaves (leaves are edible too).

name: F1 Bolder
description: Highly regarded for flavour whether eaten fresh, juiced, or cooked.

name: Boltardy
description: The variety has good resistance to bolting. A widely grown variety.

name: Albina Verduna
description: An unusual white fleshed beetroot with edible leaves. The bulbs are highly regarded for their sweet flavour.

name: Burpees Golden
description: Distinctive orange to yellow flesh with edibles leaves that can be added to salads or cooked like spinach.

name: F1 Pablo
description: Well regarded round crimson roots. Good flavour and good for shows.

name: F1 Action
description: Relatively small roots, but quick to mature.

name: Cylindra
description: Unusual shaped beetroot with long rather than round bulbs. Good reputation for flavour and stores well.

name: Chioggia
description: A beetroot that has striking pink and white hooped flesh when cut. Originating from Italy.

name: Barabietola Di Chioggia
description: Traditional Italian variety. Best cooked.

name: Rhonda
description: Well regarded for flavour. Dramatic deep colouring.
